data.name: Cooper Hewitt API
data.description: A moderated, remote usability study of the Cooper Hewitt API, completed in partnership with the Cooper Hewitt, Smithsonian Design Museum.
data.secondaryDescription: This study focused on the usability of the Cooper Hewitt API documentation and onboarding experience. Our design recommendations aim to drive additional users to the API by removing hurdles commonly experienced by novice developers.

data.name: Declined Transactions Alerts
data.description: Research and implementation of a real-time push notification service for declined point-of-sale debit transactions, completed for Capital One Consumer Bank.
data.secondaryDescription: Release of this product has promoted mobile self-service, alleviated customer frustration, and driven a dramatic reduction of customer service costs.

data.name: Claims Automation
data.description: A modernization of the fraud and disputes claims experience for debit customers, completed for Capital One 360 Checking.
data.secondaryDescription: Implementation of this project has heightened account security, streamlined the claims process, and reduced call volume and wait time.

data.name: Etsy Search Experience
data.description: An unmoderated, remote usability study of the Etsy search and checkout experience.
data.secondaryDescription: This study's intent was to evaluate navigation across the site, and our recommendations focused on refining search and shipping information retrieval.

data.name: Barriers to Financial Literacy
data.description: A literature-based study of informational barriers to financial literacy and an evaluation of effective financial education.
data.secondaryDescription: This study identified information access, numeracy and literacy, and institutional gatekeeping as major preventers of financial literacy.

data.name: EHR Redesign
data.description: A human-centered redesign of Vanderbilt University Medical Center's electronic health record (EHR) systems.
data.secondaryDescription: This study analyzed the role of EHRs in primary care physician's formulation of chronic pain care. The design recommendations focus on consolidating patient information and medical history into a single page application.
